messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] unhousekeeping
messages.msgSnippet: Yes, all she did was the TB thingy to prove they hadn t been exposed or weren t carriers. Lynda ... From: pagan.screaming.net To:
messages.messageBody:
Yes, all she did was the TB thingy to prove they hadn't been exposed or weren't carriers.
 
Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: pagan.screaming.net
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, February 16, 2001 1:31 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] unhousekeeping

 

Kathy B Cauley wrote:

 

>Is anyone else watching E.R.
They make the mother out to be a complete idiot!
I am so pissed right now I can't think.
I used to really like this show but now I'm so confused!!!!
Kathy in TX.
unschooler & unimmunized
>
>
>

Not a 'you must have your children immunised or you will all die' episode?
Sigh. I'm facing the American embassy in London in a few weeks. I have to see the embassy doc for a medical exam and explain why ky kids are not immunised. It's one of the conditions for enetering the US as a 'alien' although there is a waiver form. Anyone know anyone who's used it?

Shyrley

things. I hope it works out. $$ is a good thing,
sometimes.

messages.msgSnippet: ... heeh, I actually thought of that yesterday when i was reading the whole chocolate idea, I thought well, it would have to be like rigged up in some
messages.messageBody:
--- cmas100@... wrote:

> I have thought of what it would be like to give
> myself some kind of
> motivation (other than having lots of company), like
> chocolate or
> something else indulgent but I can't fool myself
> like that! Knowing
> me, I'd just walk into the laundry room and eat the
> candy, never
> looking at the 6 FULL laundry baskets (some dirty,
> some clean, some
> folded, rarely put away)!
>

heeh, I actually thought of that yesterday when i was
reading the whole chocolate idea, I thought well, it
would have to be like rigged up in some way...like a
mousetrap for unhousekeepers...so that I could not
obtain and remove the wrapper unless the clothes were
put away....hm....too bad I'm not patient enough to
actually invent such a thing...

> I do have to say that this nesting thing is getting
> out of hand,
> though (baby's coming in a month!) and things like
> clean ceiling fans
> seem really important right now! Go figure...
>
hey! too bad you don't live near me. me and my *betend
sil" are starting a "detail cleaning" business....
(sounds funny I know after my rambling about hating
housework, but it's different if you're getting paid,
I guess)...not doing "housecleaning" (trash,
vacuuming, bathrooms) for a flat fee but doing detail
work (windows-as in every area of the window...light
fixtures/fans...blinds....megadusting....ovens...
screens...walls....vents...tile/grout...etc etc etc)
that is charged by each item...
we are passing out flyers this weekend.
maybe some $$$ will come of it. hope so.
-Bobbie
-unfortunately NOT nesting in any way...unless you
consider gathering clutter to make it look more "lived
in" nesting....

messages.subject: unhousekeeping
messages.msgSnippet: UNHOUSEKEEPING!!!!  Now I have a name for it that really fits into my lifestyle, thank you!!  I hated calling myself a bad housekeeper or domestically
messages.messageBody:
UNHOUSEKEEPING!!!! Now I have a name for it that really fits into my
lifestyle, thank you!! I hated calling myself a "bad housekeeper"
or "domestically challenged" or thinking about how I've always,
always hated housework. One of the ironies of my life, as I point
out to my husband every now & then, is that part of my "job
description" <g> would be housekeeping, which I'm horrible at and
HATE!

I have thought of what it would be like to give myself some kind of
motivation (other than having lots of company), like chocolate or
something else indulgent but I can't fool myself like that! Knowing
me, I'd just walk into the laundry room and eat the candy, never
looking at the 6 FULL laundry baskets (some dirty, some clean, some
folded, rarely put away)!

I do have to say that this nesting thing is getting out of hand,
though (baby's coming in a month!) and things like clean ceiling fans
seem really important right now! Go figure...
